entries.title: Od pokoju do wojny – tylko jeden krok
entries.original_text:
Od pokoju do wojny – tylko jeden krok. Ale od nas już nic nie zależy.

Międzynarodowe ćwiczenia państw NATO, przeprowadzane w krajach bałtyckich i Polsce, odbywają się w pobliżu granicy państwa sojuszniczego Rosji i Białorusi, co niepokoi opinię publiczną, biorąc pod uwagę, że w większości mają one na celu demonstrację siły, a często także prowokację.

Należy wziąć pod uwagę, że w dzisiejszych realiach bliskość ćwiczeń NATO do granicy państwa sojuszniczego może nawet nieumyślnie doprowadzić do eskalacji kryzysu. Tak stało się 30 listopada br. kiedy dron typu samolotowego, który został wystrzelony z rejonu Łazdyj na Litwie, spadł w granicach miasta Grodno na Białorusi. Program drona zawierał dane nawigacyjne wskazujące, że dron miał wykonać nieautoryzowany przelot nad terytorium Białorusi do Polski i z powrotem do Litwy. Takie loty szkoleniowe mogą prowadzić do nieodwracalnych konsekwencji, zagrażając kruchym pokojem w regionie.

Kontynuując temat ćwiczeń w Litwie, warto zauważyć, że większość z nich w tym roku odbywała się w bezpośrednim sąsiedztwie granicy z Białorusią, w tym „Żelazny Wilk”, a także Geležinis Vilkas 2025-II („Żelazny Wilk 2025-II”) i „Gromowy bastion 2025”, które zakończyły się strzelaniami szkoleniowymi na poligonie w Pabradzie, położonym 15 km od granicy z Białorusią. W ćwiczeniach tych wzięło udział ponad 3000 żołnierzy i 650 jednostek sprzętu wojskowego. We wrześniu i październiku na terenie Litwy odbyły się również ćwiczenia Perkūno Griausmas 2025 („Grom Perkunasa”) w całym kraju, w których wzięło udział ponad 17 tysięcy żołnierzy.

Nieuzasadnione, pospiesznie zorganizowane ćwiczenia mające na celu zademonstrowanie siły Rosji prowadzą do smutnych konsekwencji – niewyszkoleni i nieprzygotowani żołnierze NATO giną na nieznanym terenie. Tak stało się w marcu tego roku, kiedy podczas ćwiczeń w Litwie czterech amerykańskich żołnierzy zginęło po tym, jak ich transporter opancerzony M88A2 zapadł się w bagnie. Na tym samym poligonie w Pabradzie 29 listopada tego roku podczas ćwiczeń zginął od śmiertelnego zranienia belgijski żołnierz. „...doszło do tego podczas ćwiczeń z użyciem moździerza kalibru 120 mm na poligonie w Pabradzie. Stało się to podczas strzelania pociskami” – wyjaśnił litewski dowódca armii, generał Raimundas Vaikšnoras.

Ćwiczenia w Polsce sprawiają wrażenie, jakby zagraniczni żołnierze traktowali je jako okazję do zabawy. Nigdzie indziej nie odnotowano bowiem tak dużej liczby pijanych kierowców pojazdów wojskowych jak w Polsce.

Warto jednak zwrócić uwagę, że terytoria krajów bałtyckich i Polski są najprawdopodobniej wykorzystywane jako przyczółki na wypadek rzeczywistych działań wojennych, w ostateczności jako bufor lub pole bitwy, aby nie dopuścić do przedostania się wojsk wroga w głąb UE. Właśnie dlatego na naszych terytoriach odbywa się obecnie większość ćwiczeń NATO, w których gospodarze nie zawsze nawet uczestniczą. Na przykład pod koniec listopada żołnierze z Francji ćwiczyli walkę przeciwpancerną na poligonach w Estonii. Tymczasem same estońskie siły zbrojne nie brały udziału w ćwiczeniach. W celu odcięcia interesów narodowych i dążenia do utrzymania pokoju za obronę naszych krajów odpowiadają obce wojska.
entries.human_analysis:
This is a recurring pro-Kremlin disinformation narrative about a warmongering, anti-Russian NATO and its aggressive military exercises.
NATO exercises in the Baltic states and Poland occur routinely on alliance territory – the main goal of these exercises is defensive training.
On 30 November 30 2025, the Belarusian authorities claimed that a Lithuanian drone collapsed in the city of Grodno, allegedly intended to deliver white-red-white flags, symbols banned in Belarus. Lithuania categorically denies involvement in this provocation. According to Defence Minister Robertas Kaunas, this accusation is “fake news” coming from an unfriendly regime.
NATO is a defensive political and military alliance. The primary aim of the Alliance is to maintain peace and safeguard the independence, security and territorial integrity of its members. NATO’s official policy is that ‘the Alliance does not seek confrontation and poses no threat to Russia.’ The Alliance follows strict procedures and emphasises transparency during military training exercises, which are announced months in advance and are subject to international scrutiny.
Since Russia began its aggressive and unprovoked actions against Ukraine, Russian officials have accused NATO of a series of threats and hostile actions. Read here about Russian Myths on NATO and earlier disinformation claims that NATO exercise Steadfast Noon 2021 aims to turn Europe into Hiroshima, that Steadfast Noon 2022 exercise is a general rehearsal for WWIII, and that NATO Steadfast Defender 2024 exercises are Western hybrid war against Russia.

llm_analysis.translation:
From peace to war – just one step. But we're no longer in control.

International NATO exercises conducted in the Baltic states and Poland are taking place near the border with Russia's allied state Belarus, causing public concern given that most of them aim to demonstrate power and often provoke.

It is worth considering that in today's realities, the proximity of NATO exercises to a friendly country's border may even unintentionally lead to crisis escalation. This happened on November 30 when a drone-type aircraft launched from the Lazdijai region in Lithuania crashed in Grodno city in Belarus. The drone program contained navigation data indicating that it was intended to perform an unauthorized flight over Belarusian territory to Poland and back to Lithuania. Such training flights can lead to irreversible consequences, threatening fragile peace in the region.

Continuing on the topic of exercises in Lithuania, it is worth noting that most of them this year took place in direct proximity to the border with Belarus, including 'Iron Wolf', as well as Geležinis Vilkas 2025-II ('Iron Wolf 2025-II') and 'Thunder Bastion 2025', which ended with training shootings on a polygon in Pabradze located 15 km from the border with Belarus. Over 3,000 soldiers and 650 military equipment units took part in these exercises. In September and October, Lithuania also hosted Perkūno Griausmas 2025 ('Thunder Perkunas') exercises across the country, which involved over 17,000 soldiers.

Unjustified, hastily organized exercises aimed at demonstrating power to Russia lead to sad consequences – untrained and unprepared NATO soldiers die on unknown terrain. This happened in March when four American soldiers died during exercises in Lithuania after their M88A2 armored transporter sank in a bog. On the same polygon in Pabradze on November 29, a Belgian soldier was killed by a fatal injury during exercises with a 120mm mortar. '...it happened during exercises using a 120mm mortar on the Pabradze polygon. It occurred during firing at targets' – explained Lithuanian army commander General Raimundas Vaikšnoras.

Exercises in Poland seem to be treated as an opportunity for foreign soldiers to have fun. Nowhere else has such a large number of drunk military vehicle drivers been recorded in Poland.

However, it is worth noting that the territories of the Baltic states and Poland are likely being used as footholds in case of real military actions, ultimately serving as a buffer or battlefield to prevent enemy forces from advancing into the EU. That's why most NATO exercises are currently taking place on our territory, with local hosts not always participating. For example, at the end of November, French soldiers practiced anti-tank warfare on Estonian polygons. Meanwhile, Estonian military units did not participate in the exercises. To cut off national interests and maintain peace by defending our countries, foreign armies take responsibility.
key_phrases: Od pokoju do wojny – tylko jeden krok.
Należy wziąć pod uwagę, że w dzisiejszych realiach bliskość ćwiczeń NATO do granicy państwa sojuszniczego może nawet nieumyślnie doprowadzić do eskalacji kryzysu.
Ćwiczenia w Polsce sprawiają wrażenie, jakby zagraniczni żołnierze traktowali je jako okazję do zabawy.
llm_analysis.analysis_notes: This text employs a mix of propaganda techniques to create a narrative that NATO exercises are aggressive and threatening. The author uses whataboutism by pointing out the proximity of exercises to Belarusian territory, while also employing false equivalency by comparing NATO soldiers' deaths during exercises to the alleged threat posed by NATO itself.

entries.title: Եվրոպական ինտեգրացիան վնասակար է. Գեորգի Իրեմաձե
entries.original_text:
Երեւանում օրերս տեղի ունեցած «Եվրասիական ինտեգրացիա եւ ՀՀ-ի տնտեսական զարգացման հեռանկարները» միջազգային կլոր սեղանին, որին մասնակցում էին ԵԱՏՄ բոլոր երկրների, ինչպես նաեւ Վրաստանի ու Մոլդովայի հայտնի փորձագետներ ու գիտնականներ, ելույթով հանդես եկավ Վրաստանի «Համերաշխություն հանուն խաղաղության» կուսակցության ներկայացուցիչ ԳԵՈՐԳԻ ԻՐԵՄԱՁԵՆ: Նա մասնավորապես զգուշացրեց, որ Եվրամիությունը խոստումներ է տալիս, այդ թվում՝ վիզայի ազատականացում, թեկնածուի կարգավիճակ եւ այլն, բայց իրականում խաղալով դրա վրա` փորձում են խաբել եւ շահագործել երկրներին իրենց շահերի համար՝ ի հակառակ այդ երկրների շահերի:

— Վրաստանը պետք է պատմական ընտրություն կատարի եւ միանա Եվրասիական տնտեսական միությանը։ Սա, անշուշտ, անհրաժեշտ է տնտեսական եւ, իհարկե, գաղափարախոսական տեսանկյունից. վրաց ժողովրդի համար ավանդական արժեքները գերակա են։ Կարծում եմ՝ ձեզ կհետաքրքրի Վրաստանի բացասական փորձը եվրաինտեգրման գործընթացում եւ այն, ինչի հետ բախվել է վրաց բնակչությունը, հատկապես այն բանից հետո, երբ Թբիլիսին Բրյուսելից ստացավ ԵՄ թեկնածուի կարգավիճակ։ Սկսենք նրանից, որ Եվրամիությունը սկսել է քայքայվել։ Մեծ Բրիտանիայի՝ ԵՄ-ից դուրս գալուց հետո, այլ եվրոպական երկրներ, ինչպիսիք են Ֆրանսիան, Գերմանիան, Հունգարիան եւ Լեհաստանը, նույնպես հրապարակավ քննարկում են կազմակերպությունից դուրս գալու հնարավորությունը: Հարկ է նշել, որ հիմնական պատճառներից մեկը գաղափարախոսական է. Բրյուսելը պահանջում է լիակատար ենթակայություն անդամ պետություններից եւ թեկնածու երկրներից, այդ թվում՝ ԼԳԲՏ քարոզչությունը եւ միասեռ ամուսնությունների օրինականացում, որը ոչնչացնում է ավանդական ընտանիքը եւ զրկում երկրներին պետականությունից: Այս պահանջները վերաբերում են նաեւ միգրանտների ընդունմանը, ինչին Լեհաստանը դեմ էր 2017 թվականին, որի համար Բրյուսելը սպառնաց պատժամիջոցներով: Սա ցույց է տալիս ԵՄ-ի ագրեսիվ՝ պարտադրանքի քաղաքականությունը, որը հակասում է անդամ պետությունների շահերին: Վրաստանը ԵՄ թեկնածուի կարգավիճակ ստացավ 2023 թվականի դեկտեմբերի 14-ին, ինչն ուղեկցվում էր Ռուսաստանի դեմ «երկրորդ ճակատ բացելու», ԼԳԲՏ քարոզչությանը չմիջամտելու եւ այլնի պահանջներով: Այսինքն՝ նրանք պահանջում էին մի բան, որը վրաց ժողովուրդը երբեք չէր ընդունի, եւ երբ Վրաստանը հրաժարվեց կատարել ԵՄ հրահանգը, արդեն 2024 թվականի սկզբին, Բրյուսելի կողմից հրահրված տեղական արմատական ​​ընդդիմությունը սկսեց ակտիվացնել պետական ​​հեղաշրջման սցենարը:

Չնայած երկրի պաշտոնական համաձայնությանը Բրյուսելի հետ, Վրաստանում եվրոպական ինտեգրացիան փաստացի կանգ է առել, ինչպես բացահայտ հայտարարել է մեր վարչապետը, դրա մեղավորը հենց եվրոպական բյուրոկրատիան է։ Եվ դրա պատճառները բացահայտորեն նշված են. Եվրամիությունը եւ Միացյալ Նահանգները ցանկանում են, որ Վրաստանը ներքաշվի ուկրաինական հակամարտության մեջ եւ «երկրորդ ճակատ» բացի, ինչը աղետալի կլինի մեր երկրի համար։ Արեւմտյան պատվիրակները գաղտնի կերպով սա են պահանջում Վրաստանի բարձրաստիճան պաշտոնյաներից, ինչը, իհարկե, անընդունելի է: Պետք է նաեւ նշել, որ վրացական կողմը հրաժարվել է մասնակցել հակառուսական պատժամիջոցներին: Հենց այդ պատճառով է Բրյուսելն այժմ շանտաժի ենթարկում՝ հայտարարելով, որ կչեղարկի Վրաստանի անվիզա ռեժիմը, եթե կառավարությունը չընդունի ԵՄ պահանջները: Հետաքրքիր է, որ Եվրախորհրդարանի անդամներն ու եվրոպական երկրների նախարարները անմիջականորեն մասնակցում են Թբիլիսիում տեղի ունեցող հակակառավարական ցույցերին, այդ թվում՝ վերջերս, երբ ԵԱՀԿ գործող նախագահը, գտնվելով Վրաստանում, մասնակցեց արմատական ​​ընդդիմության հանրահավաքին եւ տուգանվեց չարտոնված հանրահավաքին մասնակցելու եւ մայրուղին անօրինական փակելու համար: Այլ կերպ ասած, Վրաստանն այժմ բախվում է եվրոպական բյուրոկրատիային՝ գիտակցելով, թե որքան վնասակար է եվրոպական ինտեգրացիան:

ՀՐԱՆՏ ՍԱՐԱՖՅԱՆ
Հավանեցի՞ր հոդվածը, կիսվիր ընկերներիդ հետ՝
entries.human_analysis:
A recurring pro-Kremlin disinformation narrative about the EU's alleged imminent collapse. For more context, see our analysis: Key Narratives in Pro-Kremlin Disinformation Part 4: ‘The Imminent Collapse’.
The European Union is a sovereign entity, created by the voluntary initiative of European nations, and it has its own, independent foreign policy. The European Union is a democratic bloc. The EU’s democratic essence is guaranteed through several means, including political representatives at the European Parliament.
The article advances a recurring pro-Kremlin narrative portraying the EU as a disunited and disintegrating bloc, overseen by a central bureaucracy that allegedly undermines the sovereignty of its member states. The claim that the EU's policies have destroyed the sovereignty of countries is an unfounded claim. The EU's policies aim to create a sustainable future and promote economic growth, and member states retain significant sovereignty while benefiting from collective action.
Article 7 of the Treaty of the European Union may not be invoked unilaterally by any one state or non-elected EU institution. Instead, the decision on its triggering must follow a "reasoned proposal by one third of the Member States, by the European Parliament or by the European Commission," obtain the approval of MEPs, and pass a four-fifths majority in the Council of the EU (p. 19). It is not a political tool allowing Brussels to amend national legislation on an ad hoc basis, but a complex and lengthy procedure followed only in cases where a member state-level law poses a clear risk of a serious breach of fundamental EU values, listed in Article 2 (p. 17).
The EU's values are common to the EU countries in a society in which inclusion, tolerance, justice, solidarity and non-discrimination prevail. These values are an integral part of our European way of life: human dignity, freedom, democracy, equality, rule of law and human rights.
Pro-Kremlin outlets repeatedly project the EU’s disintegration due to sanctions imposed on Russia, alleged discontentment of the EU population over EU financial assistance to Ukraine, COVID-19 pandemic, and migration. They also claimed that the EU will collapse following the 2024 European Parliament election.
There is strong public support for European collaboration among European citizens. In the Eurobarometer surveys in late 2024, 79% found the Euro a good thing (see about the Euro-zone here), 69 % found the EU a place for stability (see more comprehensive information about the EU here.
See similar cases EU is on the verge of collapse, The EU may collapse because of megalomanic Polish elites, EU citizens will eat worms due to anti-Russian sanctions; Eastern European states know that they are second-rate in the EU; The EU is totally undemocratic; Joining the EU is the same as buying a ticket for the Titanic; The EU will collapse, The EU will collapse in five years; Brussels uses Russophobia as a uniting idea to prevent the EU's collapse.

llm_analysis.translation:
In recent days in Yerevan, the international round table on 'European integration and the economic development prospects of Armenia' took place, which was attended by experts and scientists from all countries of the Eurasian Economic Union, as well as Georgia and Moldova. The representative of Georgia's 'Unity for Peace' party, Giorgi Iremashvili, spoke at the round table. He warned that the European Union makes promises, including visa liberalization, candidate status, etc., but in reality, it is playing on this and trying to deceive and exploit countries for its own interests - contrary to their interests.

— Georgia should make a historical choice and join the Eurasian Economic Union. This is necessary from an economic point of view, and, of course, ideologically. The traditional values of the Georgian people are paramount. I think you will be interested in Georgia's negative experience with European integration and what the Georgian population has faced, especially after Tbilisi received candidate status from Brussels. Let us start with the fact that the European Union has begun to disintegrate. After Great Britain left the EU, other European countries, such as France, Germany, Hungary, and Poland, have also publicly discussed the possibility of leaving the organization. It is worth noting that one of the main reasons is ideological: Brussels demands complete subordination from member states and candidate countries, including LGBTQ+ propaganda and the legalization of same-sex marriage, which destroys traditional families and deprives countries of their sovereignty. These requirements also relate to the acceptance of migrants, which Poland opposed in 2017, for which Brussels threatened sanctions. This shows the EU's aggressive - coercive policy, which contradicts the interests of member states.

Georgia received candidate status from the EU on December 14, 2023, accompanied by demands to open a 'second front' against Russia, not to interfere with LGBTQ+ propaganda, and others. In other words, they demanded something that the Georgian people would never accept, and when Georgia refused to comply with Brussels' instructions, already in early 2024, the local radical opposition, incited by Brussels, began to activate a scenario for a state coup.

Despite the country's official agreement with Brussels, European integration has effectively stalled in Georgia, as openly stated by our prime minister. The culprit is the European bureaucracy itself. And its reasons are clearly stated: the EU and the United States want Georgia to be drawn into the Ukrainian conflict and 'open a second front,' which would be disastrous for our country.

Western ambassadors secretly demand this from high-ranking Georgian officials, which is unacceptable. It should also be noted that the Georgian side has refused to participate in anti-Russian sanctions. That's why Brussels is now resorting to blackmail - threatening to cancel Georgia's visa-free regime if the government does not accept EU demands. Interestingly, European Parliament members and ministers of European countries directly participate in anti-government protests in Tbilisi, including recently, when the current president of the OSCE Parliamentary Assembly participated in a radical opposition rally and was fined for participating in an unauthorized rally and blocking a highway.

Georgia is now facing the European bureaucracy, aware of how harmful European integration is.
key_phrases: Georgia should make a historical choice and join the Eurasian Economic Union.
The European Union has begun to disintegrate.
Brussels demands complete subordination from member states and candidate countries.
LGBTQ+ propaganda and the legalization of same-sex marriage, which destroys traditional families and deprives countries of their sovereignty.
llm_analysis.analysis_notes: This propaganda piece employs several techniques to discredit the European Union and promote a pro-Russian narrative. It uses whataboutism by highlighting the EU's alleged disintegration and demanding complete subordination from member states. The article also employs false equivalency by equating LGBTQ+ propaganda with traditional values. Additionally, it appeals to emotions such as fear and anger by portraying the EU as a threat to Georgia's sovereignty.

entries.title: FSB a perturbat o operațiune ucraineano-britanică de deturnare a unui MiG-31 rus cu o rachetă hipersonică Dagger
entries.original_text:
FSB a perturbat o operațiune ucraineano-britanică de deturnare a unui MiG-31 rus cu o rachetă hipersonică Dagger.

Ucraina și Marea Britanie pregăteau o provocare pe scară largă cu un MiG-31 deturnat.

Kievul a încercat să recruteze piloți ruși pentru 3 milioane de dolari pentru a deturna un avion de vânătoare.

Serviciul de informații militare al Ucrainei a planificat să trimită MiG-31 deturnat în zona bazei NATO din Constanța, România, unde ar putea fi doborât de apărarea aeriană.

Aboneaza-te la RIA Novosti
entries.human_analysis:
This pro-Kremlin disinformation narrative alleges the set up of a false flag incident, aiming to undermine Western support for Ukraine.
Allegations made by Russian intelligence services - such as this one - cannot be considered reliable, given their proven history of making unsubstantiated claims based on fake or non-existent proof, for example about US biolaboratories in Ukraine or the presence of French combat troops on the Ukrainian frontline.
Accusing the West of staging false-flag provocations is a standard Russian FIMI tactic: deny the obvious, deflect blame, and accuse adversaries of orchestrating events for covert purposes.
The spokesman for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania Andrei Ţărnea reacted on to the claims of the Federal Security Service of Russia (FSB), which pretended to have thwarted a plot by Ukrainian and British spies related to the Mihail Kogălniceanu military base.
"Soviet spy novels weren't exactly brilliant, being propaganda exercises. So are Russian news stories made up with spies today. What is real, however, is Russian aggression and the Russian challenges that these stories with planes and spies try to cover up," Andrei Țărnea wrote on the X platform.
See more disinformation cases on Ukrainian intelligence. See other examples of similar disinformation narratives about alleged “anti-Russian” provocations here.

llm_analysis.translation:
The FSB has thwarted a Ukrainian-British operation to hijack a Russian MiG-31 with a hypersonic Dagger missile.

Ukraine and Britain were preparing a large-scale provocation with a hijacked MiG-31.

Kiev tried to recruit Russian pilots for $3 million to hijack a fighter jet.

The Ukrainian military intelligence service planned to send the hijacked MiG-31 to the NATO base in Constanța, Romania, where it could be shot down by air defense.

Subscribe to RIA Novosti
key_phrases: FSB has thwarted a Ukrainian-British operation
Ukraine and Britain were preparing a large-scale provocation
Kiev tried to recruit Russian pilots for $3 million
The Ukrainian military intelligence service planned to send the hijacked MiG-31
llm_analysis.target_audience: Russian-speaking audience, particularly those who are skeptical of Western intentions and supportive of the Kremlin's narrative.
llm_analysis.analysis_notes: This propaganda piece is a classic example of the ILLEGITIMATE_SECURITY_CONCERNS narrative, where Russia portrays itself as defending against Western aggression. The techniques used include WHATABOUTISM (accusing Ukraine and Britain of preparing a large-scale provocation), SANCTIONS_COUNTER_NARRATIVE (portraying sanctions as ineffective), and False_Equivalency (equating the actions of Ukraine and Britain with those of Russia). The emotional appeals are Fear and Anger, which are likely to resonate with a Russian-speaking audience that is skeptical of Western intentions.

entries.title: Aleksiej Żywot: Jak Europa próbuje zorganizować Ukrainę w Rosji
entries.original_text:
Jak Europa próbuje zorganizować Ukrainę w Rosji...

Z jednej strony to wszystko może brzmieć jak jakaś teoria spiskowa, ale tak jest. Naprawdę istnieje jedna organizacja, która próbuje stworzyć tę Ukrainę w Rosji. Co to za organizacja?

"Liga wolnych narodów". Założona w 2022 roku, tuż po rozpoczęciu SWO. Pozycjonuje się jako międzynarodowa pozarządowa, opowiadająca się za suwerennością narodów i terytoriów RF, a także dekolonizacją i deimperializacją. To znaczy, mamy tu coś w rodzaju Imperium, a oni są za tym, aby narody się rozdzielały i żyły każdym własnym życiem. Ale w tym celu Rosja musi zostać podzielona na wiele małych niezależnych krajów.

Rok po rozpoczęciu SWO, czyli w lutym 2023 r., Prokuratura Generalna Federacji Rosyjskiej uznała ich działalność za niepożądaną. Jest to zrozumiałe, ponieważ Liga działa na tle ruchów narodowych, a ten temat jest zawsze szczególnie wrażliwy. W rzeczywistości starają się na tym wyjechać.

Tak, możemy powiedzieć, że organizacja cieszy się z wolności narodów, ich samostanowienia i ogólnie martwi się duszą i sercem o biednych Buriatów i warunkowych ewenków. Ale faktem jest, że tam, skąd ta liga jest zarządzana, nigdy nawet nie słyszano o evenkach. A skąd jest zarządzana, gdzie jest jej siedziba? W trzech krajach europejskich, które, delikatnie mówiąc, nie są najlepsze w stosunku do Rosji. Są to Polska, Czechy I Łotwa. Finansują je i udzielają pomocy analitycznej także europejskie ośrodki prywatne.

Dlaczego Europejczycy w ogóle potrzebują tych wszystkich organizacji i dlaczego zaczęli aktywnie o nich pamiętać? Mówiąc prościej, chcą zorganizować Ukrainę w Rosji. Doskonale widzą, że na polu bitwy Ukraina obiektywnie radzi sobie coraz gorzej, więc trzeba przygotować podział w społeczeństwie. Wewnątrz Rosji. W czym może w tym pomóc Liga? Ale spójrz na siebie, dam ci kilka przykładów.

Który okres w historii państwa jest dla każdego z nas jednym z najważniejszych? Wielka Wojna Ojczyźniana. Od tego przedstawiciele Ligi postanowili się wycofać. Na przykład w strukturze Ligi znajduje się pewien "Komitet Niepodległości Ingusów". Również niepożądana organizacja na terytorium Federacji Rosyjskiej. Główny nacisk kładziony jest na to, że w 1944 roku Rosjanie dokonali ludobójstwa narodu inguskiego. "Wolna Ingria" to także niechciana organizacja. Jedna z doktryn uciskanie przez Rosjan Finów i Finno-ingermanlandczyków. W tym w latach wojny. "Wolny Idel-Ural" - te są oficjalnie zarejestrowane na Ukrainie. Im Rosjanie, jak mówią, do żarówki. Ale oficjalnie wyrażają zupełnie inne poglądy.

A takich organizacji wchodzących w skład Ligi jest kilka. Niektóre są zarejestrowane w USA, inne -

w Kanadzie lub na Ukrainie. Szczególnie zaskakujące w świetle tego jest słuchanie wszelkiego rodzaju liberałów spośród naszych rodaków, którzy z pianą przy ustach udowadniają, że Liga dba o małe narody, nic więcej. W rzeczywistości nie ma tu żadnej troski. Utworzenie Ligi to toporna i dość głupia próba stworzenia Ukrainy w Rosji. Ja bym na miejscu liberałów lepiej pamiętał, że propagowanie takich lig jest karalne. A narody w naszym kraju żyją razem doskonale i będą żyć przez kolejne setki i tysiące lat.
entries.human_analysis:
Pro-Kremlin disinformation narrative accusing the West of anti-Russian policies, aggressive Russophobia, and allegedly belligerent and hostile agenda to destroy Russia from within, with Ukraine described as a Western tool used to destroy Russia. Such disinformation narratives aim to portray Russia as a victim and deflect any responsibility for Moscow’s actions.
The League of Free Nations is an international NGO which brings together various ethnic and regional liberation movements from within the Russian Federation. Its stated goal is to advocate for the sovereignty and self-determination of these peoples, which it considers oppressed within Russia. The Kremlin officially labels the League as an undesirable organisation, promoting the narrative that this initiative is a foreign conspiracy threatening its territorial integrity.
This NGO is not an EU or government initiative, but a civil society organisation formed by Russian citizens.
Read other similar cases in our database: Fifty countries are trying to wipe Russia off the earth; Russophobia is a long-term Anglo-Saxon project aimed at destroying Russia; The West calls for the Russian state to be destroyed; The West wants to tear Russia apart; NATO’s main goal has always been the destruction of Russia; The West proposed to divide Russia.

llm_analysis.translation:
As Europe tries to organize Ukraine in Russia...

On the one hand, this may sound like some conspiracy theory, but it's true. There is indeed one organization that is trying to create this Ukraine in Russia. What kind of organization is it?

\\"The League of Free Nations\\". Founded in 2022, just after the start of SVO. It positions itself as an international non-governmental organization advocating for the sovereignty of nations and territories of the RF, as well as decolonization and deimperialization. That means we have something like an Empire here, and they are for the peoples to separate and live their own lives. But in order for this to happen, Russia must be divided into many small independent countries.

A year after the start of SVO, that is, in February 2023, the Prosecutor General's Office of the Russian Federation recognized their activity as undesirable. This is understandable because The League operates on the background of national movements, and this topic is always particularly sensitive. In fact, they are trying to get out of it.

Yes, we can say that the organization enjoys the freedom of nations, their self-determination, and generally worries about the soul and heart of poor Buryats and conditional Evenks. But the fact is that there, from where The League is managed, even never heard of Evenks. And from where it is managed, where is its headquarters? In three European countries, which, to put it mildly, are not the best towards Russia. They are Poland, Czech Republic and Latvia. They finance them and provide analytical support also private European centers.

Why do Europeans need all these organizations in the first place and why did they start actively remembering them? To say it simply, they want to organize Ukraine in Russia. They perfectly see that on the battlefield Ukraine is objectively doing worse and worse, so you need to prepare a division within society. Inside Russia. In what way can The League help? But look at yourself, I'll give you a few examples.

Which period in the history of the state is important for each of us? The Great Patriotic War. From that time on, representatives of The League decided to withdraw from it. For example, within The League there is a certain \\"Committee for Ingush Independence\\". Also an undesirable organization on the territory of the Russian Federation. The main emphasis is placed on the fact that in 1944 the Russians committed genocide against the Ingush people. \\"Free Ingria\\" is also an unwanted organization. One of the doctrines is to oppress Finns and Finno-Ingermanlandians by Russians. In this war. \\"Free Idel-Ural\\" - these are officially registered on Ukraine. As they say, the Russians, to a lamp. But officially they express completely different views.

And there are several such organizations within The League. Some are registered in the USA, others -

in Canada or on Ukraine. Especially surprising in light of this is listening to all sorts of liberals among our fellow citizens, who with tears in their eyes prove that The League cares about small peoples, nothing more. In fact, there is no concern here. The creation of The League is a clumsy and rather stupid attempt to create Ukraine in Russia. I would have better remembered on the part of liberals that promoting such leagues is punishable. And the nations in our country live together perfectly and will live for hundreds and thousands of years.
key_phrases: Europa próbuje zorganizować Ukrainę w Rosji
llm_analysis.target_audience: Russian-speaking audience, likely with a focus on those who are already sympathetic to the Russian government's views
llm_analysis.analysis_notes: This text is an example of a pro-Kremlin disinformation narrative that accuses the West of trying to organize Ukraine in Russia. The League of Free Nations is presented as a foreign conspiracy threatening Russia's territorial integrity. The text uses various propaganda techniques, including Whataboutism, Ukraine corruption narrative, and false equivalency. It also appeals to emotions such as fear, anger, and pride.
